course_title: Studies in Music Theory: Theories of Rhythm and Meter
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 12 / Seats Avail: 5Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes: This writing-intensive upper-elective explores the human perception of time in music; how do we experience musical time and how do performers shape the flow of meter and hypermeter? Repertoire will include Western, non-Western, and popular (such as the flow in rap music) examples.
course_description: This is a variable topics course in music theory. Each study treats a special topic in the field by implementing various analytical techniques, discussion sessions, and writing of papers.
prerequisites: MUS 221 or equivalent transfer credit as prerequisite.
sections: Class Nbr: 5638, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: M 2:40-3:55p, Instructor: L. Emmery, Status: Open
